telegram-mcp-stdio.comment: Stdio mode (default) - Server runs as subprocess

telegram-mcp-http.comment: HTTP mode - Server runs independently, Claude connects via HTTP

telegram-mcp-http-remote.comment: HTTP mode (remote server) - For production deployment

_instructions.stdio_mode: Use 'telegram-mcp-stdio' for local development. The server runs as a subprocess managed by Claude Desktop.
_instructions.http_mode_local: Use 'telegram-mcp-http' for local HTTP mode. Start the server separately with 'MCP_TRANSPORT=http python main.py' or 'docker-compose up'.
_instructions.http_mode_remote: Use 'telegram-mcp-http-remote' for production. Deploy the server to a cloud provider and update the URL accordingly.
_instructions.note: Only enable ONE telegram-mcp configuration at a time by commenting out the others or removing unused entries.
